title: Sequence Alignment and Classic String Matching
description: An exploration of how sequence alignment methods draw on classic string-matching algorithms and dynamic programming principles.

title: Living With “Future Shock” in Research
description: A reflection on how rapid technological change shapes research practice and long-term adaptability.

title: What PCA Captures in Genetic Data and What It Doesn’t
description: A discussion of what linear dimensionality reduction reveals in genetic data, and where its limitations become apparent.

title: What Heatmaps Show and What They Don’t
description: An examination of how heatmaps encode analytical choices, and why interpretation depends on scaling and similarity definitions.

title: Designing LD-Aware Genome Embeddings: Modeling choices and Trade-offs
description: A survey of the design constraints and trade-offs involved in learning genome embeddings that respect linkage disequilibrium structure.

title: What Regularization Means in Representation Learning
description: An overview of how different regularization strategies shape learned representations, with a focus on VAEs.

title: What We Mean by Genetic Data: DNA and RNA
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part I: an introduction to DNA and RNA as distinct layers of genetic data and the types of questions they support.

title: DNA Sequencing Explained: What Does Reading the Genome Mean?
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part II: a practical overview of what DNA sequencing measures and how it differs from other genomic data types.

title: RNA Sequencing Explained: Measuring Gene Expression
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part III: an overview of what RNA sequencing measures and how gene expression differs from genetic variation.

title: Genotyping Arrays Explained: Measuring Selected Genetic Variation
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part IV: what genotyping arrays measure, how imputation expands coverage, and why arrays remain central to large-scale GWAS.

title: Comparative Analysis: What Each Measures and Why
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part V: a conceptual comparison of DNA sequencing, RNA sequencing, and genotyping arrays, and how their measurement trade-offs shape study design.

title: What Are Complex Diseases?
description: An explanation of why many common diseases arise from interacting genetic, environmental, and regulatory systems.
